channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SHDP-92] ConfigurationFactoryBean configuration causes infinite loop in Filesystem.newinstance
item.description:
follwing code will cause infinite loop:

ConfigurationFactoryBean cfactory = new
ConfigurationFactoryBean();
cfactory.setRegisterUrlHandler(true);
cfactory.afterPropertiesSet();
System.out.println("cfactory configured");
cfactory.getObject();
System.out.println("configuration retrieved from cfactory");
FileSystem fs = FileSystem.newInstance(cfactory.getObject());
System.out.println("filesystem instance created");

here is output:

12/07/10 10:42:55 INFO configuration.ConfigurationFactoryBean: Registered HDFS URL stream handler
cfactory configured
configuration retrieved from cfactory
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.StackOverflowError
at java.lang.String.startsWith(String.java:1462)

item.summary: ConfigurationFactoryBean configuration causes infinite loop in Filesystem.newinstance

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
if use change code to

cfactory.setRegisterUrlHandler(false);

then it didnt go into infinite loop.
Fixed in master. The bug is caused by the hadoop code base (as you can tell from the stacktrace). Nevertheless the registration handles this case now so.
can you refresh snapshot? latest availablr is spring-data-hadoop-1.0.0.BUILD-20120709.231509-162.jar and it does not have fix
The snapshot is published daily and is built once per day (the next one is scheduled in 2h). I've triggered one manually so you can test it faster.

This issue was fixed in hadoop (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-8585), so workaround is no more necessary. There is another problem with hadoop-2.0.3-SNAPSHOT which can be caused by your fix.

new problem is: (it hangs if you try to load classes from JAR on HDFS).

if removing your old workaround didnt fix that issue, then new workaround will be (guessing) call hadoop.fs.FileSystem.getFileSystemClass(anything) to force init.
make snapshot without fix, i will test it.

Removing the fix causes the cycle to occur in Hadoop 1.x line which is what we support. As you mentioned in the other issue, eagerly initializing Hadoop Fs fixed this in Hadoop 2.x (which is currently alpha). Based on the Hadoop comments, it looks like the dust hasn't yet settled over the issue so there might be other changes until Hadoop 2 becomes stable.
Updating this issue - Spring for Apache Hadoop is tested daily against CDH3 and CDH4 and currently we cannot reproduce this issue against CDH4 (which includes some updates from Hadoop 2.x).
it can not be detected from junit test running from maven. detection works from junit test in eclipse.
here is hadoop ticket for this issue - https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-9041

Our build is not using maven but gradle. Since you mention Eclipse it looks like it's an environment specific issue. Note that ideally you want your tests to be as close as possible to the runtime env (maven/gradle are closer to that in this case then Eclipse).
Either way just wanted to point out the CI environment suitable for finding bugs on certain distros.
Its also reproducible in plain java/groovy program or in hadoop job driver. Just not in junit running from maven3 build.
Interesting... The issue that you linked showed however that the bug was fixed in 2.0.3 and 3.0.0 so this is a non-issue, correct?
